  by

/-- If there are zero morphisms, any terminal object is a zero object. -/
theorem has_zero_object_of_has_terminal_object [has_zero_morphisms C] [has_terminal C] : has_zero_object C :=
  by
  refine' ⟨⟨«expr⊤_ » C, fun X => ⟨⟨⟨0⟩, fun f => _⟩⟩, fun X => ⟨⟨⟨0⟩, by tidy⟩⟩⟩⟩

    _ = «expr ≫ » 0 f := by congr
    _ = 0 := zero_comp

/-- If there are zero morphisms, any initial object is a zero object. -/
theorem has_zero_object_of_has_initial_object [has_zero_morphisms C] [has_initial C] : has_zero_object C :=
  by
  refine' ⟨⟨«expr⊥_ » C, fun X => ⟨⟨⟨0⟩, by tidy⟩⟩, fun X => ⟨⟨⟨0⟩, fun f => _⟩⟩⟩⟩

ext_aux:
/-- This lemma will be immediately superseded by `ext`, below. -/
private theorem ext_aux (I J : has_zero_morphisms C)
    (w : ∀ X Y : C, (@has_zero_morphisms.has_zero _ _ I X Y).zero = (@has_zero_morphisms.has_zero _ _ J X Y).zero) :
    I = J := by
  cases I; cases J
  congr
  · ext (X Y)
    exact w X Y
  · apply proof_irrel_heq
  · apply proof_irrel_heq
#align ext_aux ext_aux
ext:
/-- If you're tempted to use this lemma "in the wild", you should probably
carefully consider whether you've made a mistake in allowing two
instances of `has_zero_morphisms` to exist at all.

See, particularly, the note on `zero_morphisms_of_zero_object` below.
-/
theorem ext (I J : has_zero_morphisms C) : I = J := by
  apply ext_aux
  intro X Y
  rw [← @has_zero_morphisms.comp_zero _ _ I X X (@has_zero_morphisms.has_zero _ _ J X X).zero]
  rw [@has_zero_morphisms.zero_comp _ _ J]
#align ext ext

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
theorem eq_zero_of_src {X Y : C} (o : is_zero X) (f : «expr ⟶ » X Y) : f = 0 :=
  o.eq_of_src _ _
#align eq_zero_of_src eq_zero_of_src
eq_zero_of_image_eq_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
theorem eq_zero_of_image_eq_zero {X Y : C} {f : «expr ⟶ » X Y} [has_image f] (w : image.ι f = 0) : f = 0 := by
  rw [← image.fac f, w, has_zero_morphisms.comp_zero]
#align eq_zero_of_image_eq_zero eq_zero_of_image_eq_zero
epi_of_target_iso_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≅ » -/
theorem epi_of_target_iso_zero {X Y : C} (f : «expr ⟶ » X Y) (i : «expr ≅ » Y 0) : Epi f :=
  ⟨fun Z g h w => by rw [zero_of_source_iso_zero g i, zero_of_source_iso_zero h i]⟩
#align epi_of_target_iso_zero epi_of_target_iso_zero
comp_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/

/-

@[simp]
theorem comp_zero [has_zero_morphisms C] {X Y : C} {f : «expr ⟶ » X Y} {Z : C} :
    «expr ≫ » f (0 : «expr ⟶ » Y Z) = (0 : «expr ⟶ » X Z) :=
  has_zero_morphisms.comp_zero f Z
#align comp_zero comp_zero
comp_factor_thru_image_eq_zero:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
theorem comp_factor_thru_image_eq_zero {X Y Z : C} {f : «expr ⟶ » X Y} {g : «expr ⟶ » Y Z} [has_image g]
    (h : «expr ≫ » f g = 0) : «expr ≫ » f (factor_thru_image g) = 0 :=
  zero_of_comp_mono (image.ι g) <| by simp [h]
#align comp_factor_thru_image_eq_zero comp_factor_thru_image_eq_zero
